edu.umn.nlpengine

Interface TextRange

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Document
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDocument, AbstractTextRange, Label, Span

    public TextRange

    A location in text. Its indices consistent with String.substring and CharSequence.subSequence

    By default is sorted ascending start indexes then ascending end indexes.

    See Also:
    String.substring, CharSequence.subSequence

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  TextRange.DefaultImpls
      A location in text. Its indices consistent with String.substring and CharSequence.subSequence

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkIndexes()
      Performs a sanity check to make sure the indexes make sense, that TextRange.getStartIndex is greater than or equal to 0, and that TextRange.getEndIndex is greater than or equal to TextRange.getStartIndex.
      int compareLocation(TextRange textRange)
      Compares the location of two labels, first comparing TextRange.getStartIndex, then comparing TextRange.getEndIndex
      int compareStart(TextRange textRange)
      Compares the TextRange.getStartIndex of two labels using natural ordering
      int compareTo(TextRange other) 
      boolean contains(TextRange other)
      Checks if the label other is contained by this label
      java.lang.String coveredString(java.lang.String string)
      Gets a substring of the covered string from string
      java.lang.CharSequence coveredText(java.lang.CharSequence charSequence)
      Gets the sub sequence of covered text from charSequence
      int getEndIndex()
      The index after any characters included in this label
      int getLength()
      A computed property how long the text range is, number of characters covered by this label.
      int getStartIndex()
      The index of the first character
      int length()
      A function which returns the length of this text range.
      boolean locationEquals(TextRange other)
      Checks if the location in text of this label equals the location in text of the label other
      Span offset(int value)
      Creates a new span by shifting the interface TextRange by value characters.
      Span offsetRightByStartIndex(TextRange textRange)
      Creates a new span by shifting this text range's indexes by TextRange.getStartIndex of textRange characters. If this object is relative to textRange has the effect of normalizing it to the same 0-basis.
      void requireBounds(java.lang.CharSequence charSequence)
      Used to check that the text sequence has a valid TextRange.getStartIndex and TextRange.getEndIndex
      kotlin.ranges.IntRange toIntRange()
      Converts to an IntRange
      Span toSpan()
      Transforms this label into a class Span of just this label's TextRange.getStartIndex and TextRange.getEndIndex.
      Span trim(java.lang.CharSequence charSequence)
      Returns a new class Span which trims all the whitespace from this interface TextRange.

      • offset

        Span offset(int value)

        Creates a new span by shifting the interface TextRange by value characters.

        See Also:
        interface TextRange

      • offsetRightByStartIndex

        Span offsetRightByStartIndex(TextRange textRange)

        Creates a new span by shifting this text range's indexes by TextRange.getStartIndex of textRange characters. If this object is relative to textRange has the effect of normalizing it to the same 0-basis.

        See Also:
        TextRange.getStartIndex

      • checkIndexes

        void checkIndexes()

        Performs a sanity check to make sure the indexes make sense, that TextRange.getStartIndex is greater than or equal to 0, and that TextRange.getEndIndex is greater than or equal to TextRange.getStartIndex.

        Throws:
        - if it fails one of the conditions for index validity
        See Also:
        TextRange.getStartIndex, TextRange.getEndIndex, TextRange.getStartIndex

      • toIntRange

        kotlin.ranges.IntRange toIntRange()

        Converts to an IntRange

        See Also:
        IntRange

      • requireBounds

        void requireBounds(java.lang.CharSequence charSequence)

        Used to check that the text sequence has a valid TextRange.getStartIndex and TextRange.getEndIndex

        See Also:
        TextRange.getStartIndex, TextRange.getEndIndex

        int compareTo(TextRange other)
